title: Build Basic Prototype
purpose: Describe the core function Build Basic Prototype.
guardrails: Focus on demonstrating the core gameplay loop without implementing full game features or polish
Use only placeholder or temporary assets; do not invest time in final art, audio, or effects
Keep code modular and easy to discard or refactor; avoid complex architectures or deep integrations
Document all assumptions, limitations, and unresolved issues clearly in the scope and playtest reports
Limit playtesting to internal stakeholders; no external distribution or public release
Respect data privacy in logs and feedback; anonymize any personally identifying information
Avoid performance or network optimization beyond what is necessary to run the prototype
Keep the effort within a 4–8 week R&D timeframe and communicate risks promptly

tasks.title: Define prototype scope, goals, and set up repository/environment.
tasks.description: Define the scope and goals of the prototype and set up the development environment and repository.

deliverables.description: Document that defines the scope, goals, core mechanics, and high-level design of the prototype including in/out-of-scope features and success criteria.

acceptance.text: Defines core loop and mechanics clearly.
Lists in-scope and out-of-scope features.
Agreed and approved by product and technical leads.

deliverables.description: Archive of the initialized repository with project skeleton, build scripts, and environment configuration files.

acceptance.text: Repository builds successfully using provided instructions.
Includes README with setup instructions.
Initial commit tagged and versioned.

tasks.title: Implement stub mechanics, basic loop, controls, and placeholder assets (art, UI, audio).
tasks.description: Develop and integrate stub mechanics, basic loop, controls, and placeholder assets into a functional prototype.

deliverables.description: Zipped source code implementing stub mechanics, control schemes, and placeholder assets for the basic gameplay loop.

acceptance.text: Implements start, play, and end states with responsive input.
Loads placeholder assets correctly without errors.
Code is modular and well-documented.

deliverables.description: Runnable build of the prototype integrating stub mechanics and placeholder assets for testing.

acceptance.text: Build runs without crashes on target hardware.
Demonstrates the basic loop, controls, and placeholder assets.
Playable start-to-finish according to scope.

tasks.title: Add instrumentation for playtest logging.
tasks.description: Implement instrumentation to collect playtest data including player interactions and timestamps.

deliverables.description: Module that captures and logs gameplay events with timestamps, anonymized player identifiers, and interaction details for analysis.

acceptance.text: Records at least 90% of interactions with accurate timestamps.
Data is anonymized and stored securely.
Module integrates seamlessly with the prototype.

tasks.title: Conduct internal playtest and gather structured feedback.
tasks.description: Plan and conduct internal playtests with structured feedback collection.

deliverables.description: Plan detailing objectives, participant selection, session structure, tasks, and metrics for internal playtesting.

acceptance.text: Specifies objectives, participant criteria, playtest tasks, metrics, and timeline.
Reviewed by playtest coordinator.
Matches scope of prototype.

deliverables.description: Spreadsheet template used to collect structured feedback from playtest participants, covering qualitative and quantitative responses.

acceptance.text: Form includes both qualitative questions and quantitative rating scales.
Used by at least three testers to record feedback.
Completed forms are stored securely.

tasks.title: Analyze playtest feedback, prioritize issues, and iterate prototype.
tasks.description: Evaluate playtest data, prioritize issues, implement improvements, and produce an updated build.

deliverables.description: Document summarizing playtest findings, prioritizing at least the top five issues, and outlining recommended improvements.

acceptance.text: Identifies and prioritizes the top five issues affecting gameplay.
Recommends mitigation steps for each issue.
Reviewed and approved by design lead.

deliverables.description: Updated prototype build reflecting changes based on prioritized feedback and fixes.

acceptance.text: Addresses at least 80% of critical issues identified.
Build runs without new critical bugs.
Changes documented in changelog.

tasks.title: Document assumptions, risks, limitations, and unresolved issues.
tasks.description: Document assumptions, risks, limitations, and unresolved issues encountered in the prototype.

deliverables.description: Comprehensive document capturing all assumptions, known limitations, risks, and unresolved issues encountered during prototype development.

acceptance.text: Lists all assumptions, limitations, risks, and unresolved issues with context.
Provides potential mitigation or next steps for each item.
Reviewed and acknowledged by project leads.

tasks.title: Compile final prototype build and playtest report.
tasks.description: Produce the final prototype build and compile a comprehensive playtest report summarizing findings and recommendations.

deliverables.description: Playable build of the final prototype with integrated improvements and bug fixes ready for handoff to the next phase.

acceptance.text: Build runs end-to-end with no critical defects.
Includes release notes and instructions for launching.
Packaged in ZIP format with clear structure.

deliverables.description: Report summarizing playtest sessions, data analysis, user feedback, issues encountered, and recommended actions for the next phase.

acceptance.text: Summarizes findings from all playtest sessions.
Presents quantitative metrics and qualitative insights.
Offers recommendations for future development.
